Of all the hundreds of Tapas places I've tried in Spain, this is still one of my favorites.  When I first stumbled upon this place a couple of years ago, there was nothing in that courtyard except an old Roman wall, and little else.  Now that square has several hip restaurants, and the area has a pretty good vibe.  I never ate inside, only outside on the patio.  Prices were reasonable, service was relaxed and friendly.  This is a keeper.oh - i'm told that they also have live music on the weekend... I'll have to try going there on a weekend night soon!
